title: 6 Neighborhoods to Consider If You Want to Buy in Dubai
text:
Downtown Dubai

If the Palm is more of a daytime lifestyle destination, Downtown offers the opposite, Ms. Morris said. Lots of buyers want to be there for the proximity to constantly buzzing nightlife, especially around the Burj Khalifa and its famous fountain show.

“It's never a dull affair to be in the center of the city,” said Rohal Kohyar, marketing manager at Gulf Sotheby’s International Realty, who estimates apartments of up to four bedrooms start from AED750,000, with penthouses from AED7 million and three- to four-bedroom villas from AED3.5 million.

Ms. Morris said clients at the very top end will spend in excess of AED40 million to AED50 million for the best properties near the Burj, the fountain and the world’s largest mall.

“There is a certain type of client that loves being [in] that end of town where literally everything is on your doorstep,” she said. “Everyone loves being around the Burj, in particular young international buyers.”
